Matrix Completion via Low-Rank Factorization


Given \(\mathbf{Y} \in\Re^{N\times M} \)

find \(\mathbf{U} \in\Re^{N\times L}\) and \(\mathbf{V} \in\Re^{M\times L} \)

so that \(\mathbf{Y} \approx \mathbf{U}\mathbf{V}^{T}\)

### Why Low-Rank
We want: A probabilistic model on matrices with:

1. Invariance by permutation of rows and columns --> The model depends only on the eigenvalues 2. A complexity measure --> A norm or pseudo-norm (\\(e.g. L_\alpha, \alpha\ge 0\\) ) on the spectrum 3. Fast to compute and memory efficient --> \\(\alpha\le 1\\) (Sparsity-inducing)

### Singular Value Decomposition (SVD)
SVD is a n optimal quadratic matrix approximator: \\( (\hat{\mathbf{U}}, \hat{\mathbf{V}}) \in \arg\min_{\mathbf{U}\in\Re^{N\times K},\mathbf{V}\in\Re^{M\times K}} \gamma(\mathbf{U},\mathbf{V}) \\) where \\(\gamma(U,V) := \||\mathbf{Y} - \mathbf{U}\mathbf{V}^{T}\||_F^2\\)

It can be solved by a partial SVD algorithm: \\( [\mathbf{U},\mathbf{D},\mathbf{V}] = \texttt{sdvs}(\mathbf{Y},K) \\) \\( \hat{\mathbf{U}} = \mathbf{U} \texttt{sqrt}(\mathbf{D}) , \hat{\mathbf{V}} = \mathbf{V} \texttt{sqrt}(\mathbf{D}) , \mathbf{D}=\texttt{diag}(d_1,...d_K,) \\)

We can use other algorithms to minimize the same objective.

### Stochastic Gradient Descent
Objective: \\( \gamma(U,V) := \sum_{(i,j)\in\Omega} (y_{ij} - \langle\mathbf{u}_i,\mathbf{v}_j\rangle)^2 \\) where \\(\Omega=\lbrace 1,\cdots,N\rbrace \otimes \lbrace1,\cdots,M\rbrace \\)
**Algorithm**: 1. Pick \\( (i,j)\in\Omega \\) uniformly at random 2. Gradient steps \\(\mathbf{u}_i \leftarrow \mathbf{u}_i - \eta (\langle\mathbf{u}_i,\mathbf{v}_j\rangle-y_{ij}) \mathbf{v}_j \\) \\(\mathbf{v}_j \leftarrow \mathbf{v}_j - \eta (\langle\mathbf{u}_i,\mathbf{v}_j\rangle-y_{ij}) \mathbf{u}_i \\) where \\(\eta\\) is the gradient step size (can be adaptive)

### Alternating Least Squares
Objective: \\( \gamma(U,V) := \||\mathbf{Y} - \mathbf{U}\mathbf{V}^{T}\||_F^2 \\)
**block-coordinate descent**: \\( \arg\min_{\mathbf{u}_i} \gamma(U,V) = \arg\min_{u_i} \||\mathbf{Y}_{i:} - \mathbf{u}_i\mathbf{V}^{T}\||_2^2 \\) \\( \arg\min_{\mathbf{v}_j} \gamma(U,V) = \arg\min_{v_j} \||\mathbf{Y}_{:j} - \mathbf{U}\mathbf{v_j}^{T}\||_2^2 \\)
Least square problems! ==> Unique solutions: \\( \mathbf{u}_i \leftarrow (\mathbf{V}^T\mathbf{V})^{-1} \mathbf{V}^T \mathbf{Y}_{i:} \\) \\( \mathbf{v}_j \leftarrow (\mathbf{U}^T\mathbf{U})^{-1} \mathbf{U}^T \mathbf{Y}_{:j} \\)
Each step can be parallelized efficiently

### Regularized Latent Semantic Indexing
Objective: \\( \gamma(U,V) := \||\mathbf{Y} - \mathbf{U}\mathbf{V}^{T}\||_F^2 + \lambda_1||\mathbf{U}||_2^2 + \lambda_2||\mathbf{V}||_1 \\) L2 for compact document-topic matrix \\(\mathbf{U}\\) L1 for sparse term-topic matrix \\(\mathbf{V}\\)
**block-coordinate descent**: \\( \arg\min_{\mathbf{u}_i} \gamma(U,V) = \arg\min_{u_i} \||\mathbf{Y}_{i:} - \mathbf{u}_i\mathbf{V}^{T}\||_2^2 + \lambda_1||\mathbf{u_i}||_2^2 \\) \\( \arg\min_{\mathbf{v}_j} \gamma(U,V) = \arg\min_{v_j} \||\mathbf{Y}_{:j} - \mathbf{U}\mathbf{v_j}^{T}\||_2^2 + \lambda_2||\mathbf{v_j}||_1 \\)
Regularized least square problems: \\( \mathbf{u}_i \leftarrow (\mathbf{V}^T\mathbf{V} + \lambda_1\mathbf{I})^{-1} \mathbf{V}^T \mathbf{Y}_{i:} \\) (ridge regression) \\(\mathbf{v}_j\\) not differentiable, but can apply co-ordinate descent
